cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 13.04mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional precipitation event and ranked 8th out of our records.  A rate of 8.6mm per hour was recorded during the 7.9 hour long storm.  The heaviest total rainfall to date occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 27.64mm over the 15.9 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked first in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
Weather alert: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since September 03, 2025.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the 4th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on August 26, 2025.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on July 18, 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (209°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 Oct 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 Oct 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 78.3 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 Oct 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1697 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 110.0m lower than yesterday, 593.8m lower than the past week, 1696.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 713m minimum and 1594m maximum, with an average of 956.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1550.7m and 2650m.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and very little to no wind will be present. Moderate rainfall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
